message_1: Let f(x) be the function x^3 - 2x^2 + 3x - 4. Find the value of f'(2), where f' denotes the derivative of f.
message_2:
To find the derivative of f(x), we will apply the power rule to each term:

f'(x) = d/dx (x^3) - d/dx (2x^2) + d/dx (3x) - d/dx (4)

f'(x) = 3x^2 - 4x + 3

Now, we will find the value of f'(2):

f'(2) = 3(2)^2 - 4(2) + 3
f'(2) = 3(4) - 8 + 3
f'(2) = 12 - 8 + 3
f'(2) = 7

So, the value of f'(2) is 7.
